name: Movies About Sports Multiple Choice Quiz | Sports in Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: In 'Champion', this legendary actor had one of his favorite roles when he played a rising boxer
questions.explanation:
Kirk Douglas.

	Good job for young Kirk

questions.text: In 'Pride of the Yankees', Gary Cooper played Lou Gehrig. Who played his wife?
William Holden was one of many actors who starred in 'Golden Boy' as a reluctant boxer. Who wrote the play?
questions.explanation:
Clifford Odets.

	Odets also did 'Country Girl'

questions.text: In 'Trapeze', Burt Lancaster and Tony Curtis are trapeze performers who clash over a woman. Who is she?
questions.explanation:
Gina Lollobrigida.

	Curtis and Lancaster were also together in 'Sweet Smell of Success'

questions.text: 'Requiem for a Heavyweight' was a solid story with a compelling cast. Who was NOT in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Van Heflin.

	Quinn was the boxer. Rooney was the trainer. Gleason was the manager. Good roles for all of them. Rod Serling story with Julie Harris also in the cast.

questions.text: In 'The Hustler', Paul Newman is a pool hustler. Who plays his girl friend?
questions.explanation:
Piper Laurie.

	One of his best early roles

questions.text: In 'Paper Lion', Alan Alda portrays a writer who learns about life in a pro football training camp. Who was the writer who actually had the experience?
questions.explanation:
George Plimpton.

	Plimpton calls himself a 'professional amateur'

questions.text: 'Body and Soul' is one of the early boxing movies. Who was the star?
'The Monty Stratton Story' was a true tale of a baseball pitcher who suffered a terrible injury. Who played Stratton?
questions.explanation:
James Stewart.

	Stewart is always good.

questions.text: 'The Great White Hope' was about a one-time boxing champion. Who played him?
questions.explanation:
James Earl Jones.

	Jack Johnson, I believe, was the real-life boxer being portrayed.
